It makes me jaded and makes me lose faith in humanity some time because I don't understand how people can do that to innocent animals. That comment from Jamie Buehrle carries a direct line to Michael Vick , who was presented with the NFL's Comeback Player of the Year Award this past weekend. Newspapers The Home Affairs Committee on Friday published the evidence it has received so far in relation to its investigation into the unauthorised tapping into or hacking of mobile communications . The most interesting bits are from Paul McMullan , who was features editors at the NoW between 1998 and 2001 when Andy Coulson was deputy editor, and from Max Mosley , who sued the NoW for breach of privacy

whether his phone had been hacked when he was Labour prime minister between 2007 and 2010. Brown's office declined to comment, but Labour deputy leader Harriet Harman said police must investigate the allegations. Hacking into people's phones is illegal. Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced, she told Sky News.`` Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist.'' GetOffTheStage 26 January 2011 4:48 PM BitterBunny 26 January 2011 4:52 PM On 17 January, three days after Keir Starmer 's statement, Mulcaire submitted a statement to the high court confirming Ian Edmondson had asked him to hack into voicemails left on a mobile phone belonging to the football agent Sky Andrew . http://www.guardian.co.uk/media/2011/jan/26/news-of-the-world-phone-hacking Then, apparently out of the blue, on the 19th, Andy Coulson tells David Cameron he's resigning, and they try bury it on the 21st. The whole thing stinks to high heaven.

a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Mr Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Mr Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Mr Colin Powell objected.
